text.p: Winnipeg Commodity Exchange canola and grain futures pre-opening call as of 0845 CDT.

CANOLA - C$0.50 to C$1.00 a tonne lower in old crop futures on lower CBOT soybean calls, expected long liquidation and a bearish technical outlook. July WCE futures crush profit margin rose to -10.67 Tuesday from -12.97 Monday. New crop canola called C$0.20 to C$0.70 lower on reduced acreage expectations to the level of early forecasts of 12.1 to 12.2 million acres versus trade expectations of 13.5 to 14.0 million ahead of the April 30 Statistics Canada March seeding intentions report. Canada's dollar fell to C$1.3932 and up on Japan's yen at 90.43.
FLAX - Steady to C$0.50 down in the July on hedges expected to be met by local short covering with technical support seen at C$342/tonne. New crop should open down C$1/tonne on spread pressure.
WESTERN BARLEY - C$0.20 to C$0.70 down on U.S. corn calls despite breaking through technical resistance in the May at C$141 Tuesday.
FEED WHEAT - Steady to C$0.30 lower on lower CBOT wheat calls but there is talk western Canadian feed wheat is C$35/tonne under valued relative to world feed wheat prices.
PEAS/OATS - Steady to US$0.50 down on allied markets.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
